description: A unit of Druid Neophytes is considered to be a Level 2 Wizard that knows the spells Awakening of the Wood and Shield of Thorns from the Lore of Life. This doesn't stop other Wizards from knowing those same spells. The unit receives an additional +1 to cast for For every 5 models of Druid Neophytes in the unit, to a maximum of +3. Each time the unit casts a spell, you must nominate one Druid Neophyte or Draidecht as the caster for the purposes of line of sight, range, etc. In the event that a Druid Neophyte unit rolls a miscast, do not roll on the Miscast table. Instead, the unit suffers D3 Wounds which Ignores Armour saves. If the unit is targeted by a rule that affects a Wizard, your opponent must choose one Druid Neophyte or Draidecht as the target.
rules.name: Druidic Rites

description: Each Hunter may use his War Hawk in addition to another missile weapon during the start of the Shooting phase. Each War Hawk can be directed against any enemy unit within line of sight. The enemy unit must take a Weapon Skill test for each War Hawk targeting them; if failed, the unit takes a Strength 3 Hit.
rules.name: War Hawks

description: All enemy units within 12 and with line of sight to the Pixies at the start of their turn must take a LD test. If failed, the unit must move straight towards them, following all the rules for Stupidity. This has no effect on units that have the Immunity (Psychology) special rule.
rules.name: Befuddling Glamour

description: Once deployed, the Stone Thrower cannot move, though it may pivot on the spot as normal.
rules.name: Stone Thrower

characteristics.$text: Flaming Attacks. Multiple Wounds (D3). Stone Thrower with Flaming Pots may choose to use the large template with this profile.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: You may take 1-2 Giants as a single Rare choice.
rules.name: Giant

characteristics.$text: Multiple Wounds (D6). Slow to Fire. A Giant may throw a rock in the Shooting phase as long as it did not charge or march that turn. If a misfire is rolled, the Giant suffers 1 Wound as it drops the rock on itself by mistake.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Every model in base contact with a Fenhulk must take a Dangerous Terrain test as if they are moving through Marsh Terrain in the first round of close combat.
rules.name: Embodiment of Albion

description: Friendly Wizards within 6" receive a +1 modifier to their channelling rolls.
rules.name: Conduit of Power

characteristics.$text: Yell and Bawl: Neither the Giant nor models in contact with it actually fight if they have not already done so this round. The Giant's side automatically wins the combat by 3 points (if both sides have a Giant that Yells and Bawls, the combat is a draw). This result has no effect against Animated Constructs.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Jump Up and Down: The Giant jumps up and down vigorously on top of the enemy. Before it starts, the Giant must test to determine if it falls over. If it falls over, work out where it falls and calculate damage as already described. Any wounds caused by the fall (on either side) count towards the combat result. If the Giant remains on its none-too-nimble feet, it will inflict three Stomp attacks.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Pick Up and...: The Giant stoops down and grabs a single Character in base contact from the target unit (Giant player's choice). If no character is present in base contact, roll again on the Big Things Chart until you get another result. The Giant grabs the model and the player rolls a D6 on the "Pick up and..." table to see what happens next.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Swing with club: The Giant fights using Random Attacks (3D6) this round.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Yell and Bawl: Neither the Giant nor models in contact with it actually fight if they have not already done so this round. The Giant's side automatically wins the combat by 3 points (if both sides have a Giant that Yells and Bawls, the combat is a draw). This result has no effect against Animated Constructs.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Thump with Club: The Giant brings down its club on a single model from the target unit that is in base contact. The target may attempt to avoid the blow by passing an I test (use the lowest if the model has several different values). If the test is failed, the model takes 2D6 wounds which Ignores Armour Saves. If a double is rolled the Giant's club embeds itself in the ground and the Giant cannot attack at all in the following round of the same combat whilst it recovers its weapon.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: 'Eadbutt: The Giant head-butts a single enemy model from the target unit, automatically inflicting D6 wounds which Ignores Armour Saves. If the victim is wounded but not slain, then it is dazed and loses all of its following attacks. If the target has not yet attacked in that combat round, it loses those attacks; if it has already attacked, then it loses the next round's attacks.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Grapple and...: The Bonegrinder Giant grabs hold of his opponent,  Roll a D6 on the "Graple and... Chart".
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Knobbly Knee: The victim immediately suffers D3 Wound which Ignores Armour Saves and has their WS and I reduced to 1 until the end of the next player turn.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Slam: The victim immediately suffers 2D3 Wounds which Ignores Armour Saves. If there is another enemy unit in base contact with the Giant, that unit also suffers 2D3 Wounds which Ignores Armour Saves. If there are two or more other enemy units in base contact with the Giant, randomise to see which is slammed.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Bear Hug: Roll 2D6 and add the Giant's S. Your opponent rolls 2D6 and adds the victim's T. If the Bonegrinder Giant's score is higher, the victim is removed as a casualty with no saves of any kind allowed.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Fall Over: Roll 2D6 and add the Giant's S. Your opponent rolls 2D6 and adds the victim's T. If the Bonegrinder Giant's score is higher, the victim is removed as a casualty with no saves of any kind allowed. Then continue to resolve the Giant falling over, in the direction of the target.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Punch, and...: The victim suffers D3 Wounds which Ignores Armour Saves, then roll again on this table. If the Giant rolls a succession of 6's it is possible for him to repeatedly punch his victim. If the punches kill the victim, there's no further need to roll on the table.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Yell and Bawl: Neither the Giant nor models in contact with it actually fight if they have not already done so this round. The Giant's side automatically wins the combat by 3 points (if both sides have a Giant that Yells and Bawls, the combat is a draw). This result has no effect against Animated Constructs.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Jump Up and Down: The Giant jumps up and down vigorously on top of the enemy. Before it starts, the Giant must test to determine if it falls over. If it falls over, work out where it falls and calculate damage as already described. Any wounds caused by the fall (on either side) count towards the combat result. If the Giant remains on its none-too-nimble feet, it will inflict three Stomp attacks.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Pick Up and...: The Giant stoops down and grabs a single Character in base contact from the target unit (Giant player's choice). If no character is present in base contact, roll again on the Big Things Chart until you get another result. The Giant grabs the model and the player rolls a D6 on the "Pick up and..." table to see what happens next.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Vomit: Place the flame template so that the narrow end is in base contact with the Bonegrinder Giant and the body of the template is over at least one other unit. All models (friendly and enemy) under the template suffer an automatic S 5 hit which Ignores Armour Saves. All unsaved Wounds from these hits count towards the combat result (unsaved Wounds on friendly models count to your opponent's combat result). Once damage has been resolved, roll a D6. On a roll of 1-3, the Bonegrinder Giant falls over.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Kick: Choose a model in base contact with the Bonegrinder Giant that model is removed as a casualty. The victim's remains hurtle through its unit in the same manner as a shot from a bolt thrower (Look Out Sir! Applies as normal). The model immediately behind the victim suffers a S 8 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3). If he is slain, the model behind him suffers a S 7 hit with Multiple Wounds (D3), and so on, until the remains fail to cause a casualty; or the unit runs out of ranks/files.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Crush!: Place the small round template so that it is at least partially covering one or more models in base contact with the Giant, but not the Giant himself. The model under the centre of the template suffers an automatic S 10 hit with Multiple Wounds (D6). Models around him might get lucky . Roll an artillery dice and halve the result  all other models (friendly and enemy) under the template suffer an automatic hit of this S. If the roll is a: misfire, the Giant manages to miss the rest of the unit.
characteristics.name: Result

characteristics.$text: Throw Back into Combat: The victim is hurled into its own unit like a living missile. The victim suffers D3 S 8 Hits which Ignores Armour saves, and D6 S 3 hits are inflicted on the unit (save as normal). If the victim is part of the targets from the Big Things Chart the unit suffers D6 S 5 hits.
characteristics.name: Result

description: To determine what happens in each Close Combat phase, pick a unit in base contact with the Bonegrinder Giant and roll a D6 on one of the tables. Which table you use depends on the size of the Bonegrinder Giant's victim. Use the Man-sized Things Chart when fighting Infantry, Cavalry, War Beasts or Swarms. Use the Big Things Chart when fighting monstrous beasts, monstrous infantry, monstrous cavalry, chariots and war machines. Use the Bigger Things Chart when fighting anything with
rules.name: Bonegrinder Giant Special Attacks

description:
A Giant must test to see whether it falls over if any of the following apply:

 If it is beaten in close combat. Test once results are established but before taking a Break test.
 If it is fleeing at the start of the Movement phase.
 When it crosses an obstacle. Test when the obstacle is reached.
 If the Giant decides to Jump Up and Down on an enemy. Test immediately beforehand.

To see if a Giant falls over roll a D6. On a roll of 1, the Giant falls over. A slain Giant falls over automatically.

To determine in which direction the Giant falls, roll a scatter dice. Place the large template in base contact with the Giant in the direction of the scatter dice, measured from the centre of the Giant's base. A model hit by the falling Giant suffers 3D6 S 8 Hits that have Multiple Wounds (D6), though no single model may suffer more than 1 Hit  any excess Hits are ignored. If the unit is in combat and the Giant has fallen over whilst attempting to Jump Up and Down, wounds inflicted by a falling Giant count towards the combat result.

A Giant that falls over automatically suffers 1 wound. If the Giant is in combat then this wound counts towards combat resolution.

Once on the ground a Giant may get up in his following Movement phase, but may not move that turn. Whilst on the ground a Giant may not attack, but he can still defend himself after a fashion so the enemy must still roll to score hits on him. If forced to flee whilst on the ground the Giant is slain. If the Giant gets the opportunity to pursue his foes whilst he's on the ground he stands up instead. A Giant may attack in close combat as usual on the turn he stands up..
rules.name: Fall Over

description: Whenever Morrigan charges into combat she inflicts 2D6 S 2 hits with Magical Attacks, distributed as shooting.
rules.name: Murder of Crows

description: All friendly units with War Fury within 8" of Morrigan gain +1 To Hit in Close Combat, and enemy units suffer -1 to their LD. However, Morrigan may never be the army's General.
rules.name: Omen of War

description: Dural Durak may reroll all Power Dice when casting a spell once per turn, as long as it wasn't a Miscast result. This is done after resolving any Unlimited Power rolls.
rules.name: High Druid

characteristics.$text: The Heartwood Staff gives Dural Durak +1 to cast, and +2 to cast if he is within 6" of a wood.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Truthsayer only. Gains Ward save (5+) and Magic Resistance (3). The Triskele is not a unique magic item, and one may be worn by each Truthsayer.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: All friendly units within 12 of Gwenlaen may re-roll failed Psychology tests and automatically pass Rally tests. In addition, the restriction on Tribal Affiliation is lifted  you may field units from any of the four tribes in the same army if you wish.
rules.name: Warrior Queen

characteristics.$text: The Sword of Ogma gives Gwenlaen Strength Bonus (2) and Devastating Charge.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: One use only. Declare if you want to use the Torc at the start of any phase. When used, the wearer cannot be harmed by any Spell, Shooting or Close Combat attack for the duration of the turn.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Shield. Enemies must re-roll all successful rolls To Hit against the wearer (both shooting and close combat).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Multiple Wounds (D6). Slow to Fire. Agum may throw a rock in the Shooting phase as long as he did not charge or march that turn. If a misfire is rolled, Agum suffers 1 Wound. Agum may re-roll the scatter dice.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Agum's 'Eadbutt attack has Multiple Wounds (D6).
rules.name: Steel Head

description: Conor must always issue and accept challenges when possible. In addition, he may choose one character in the enemy's army to be his nemesis. If Conner slays this character in a challenge, the Albion player receives +100 Victory Points. While in a challenge, Conor has Heroic Killing Blow.
rules.name: 'There Can Be Only One!'

description: Conor has Ward save (3+) against all attacks except successful Killing Blows.
rules.name: Fateful Destiny

characteristics.$text: Allows Conor to re-roll all failed rolls To Hit and To Wound.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: For every unsaved wound caused by Cormac Chath in Close Combat, all friendly units in combat within 6" receive +1 to their combat resolution bonus (to a maximum of +3).
rules.name: Hero of Albion

characteristics.$text: Great Weapon. All hits with this sword are multiplied by D3.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Heavy Armour. The Mail of Morrigan gives Cormac Ward save (6+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Enemies suffer -1 on all rolls To Wound against Cormac Chath.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: Amanthas may deploy within 5" of the enemy instead of the normal 10" and is at an additional -1 to hit with missile weapons when in Forests. In addition, she cannot be march blocked and can fire even if she marches.
rules.name: Master of the Hunt

description: When turning into his Spasm Form, Roth becomes a Monstrous Infantry model. Any Wounds suffered in either form are carried over when Roth changes form.
rules.name: Champion of Danu

characteristics.$text: The Vambraces of Danu give Roth Regeneration (6+).
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Great Weapon. All Attacks made with this weapon have Ignores Armour Saves and Killing Blow.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Grants Roth the Natural Armour (4+) special rule. In addition, enemy units within 6" of him must re-roll successful Psychology tests.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

selectionEntryGroups.name: Spells from the Lore of the Truthsayers
Spells from the Lore of the Truthsayers
Spells from the Lore of the Truthsayers
Spells from the Lore of the Truthsayers

characteristics.$text: The bearer gains +1 to all dispel attempts and +1 to all attempts to channel dispel dice.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: At the start of the Albion Magic Phase, up to D3 Wounds worth of models previously slain during the battle may be resurrected and put back into the unit (following the rules of the spell Regrowth from the Lore of Life) as long as the bearer of this item remains in it. Any friendly character slain in this unit may also be resurrected once in this manner. However, a resurrected character does not bestow his LD onto the unit, nor can the unit benefit from his War Cry ability. Resurrected Wizards can no longer cast spells.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Model on foot only. The character may transform this item into a Chariot at the start of any of his turns, as long as he is not in Close Combat. This Chariot follows all the rules for normal chariots. While in it, the character can Fly, but may not join any units. If he is in a unit when transforming the Chariot, he must immediately leave it and be placed within 1" of his unit. The character can choose to transform the Chariot back into a magic item at the end of any turn. Any wounds lost are not restored upon doing so, and if the Chariot is destroyed, the magic item is lost.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Can not be used with Magic Weapons. The bearer gains Multiple Wounds (D6) on all his Close Combat Attacks.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Shield. The Shields Parry becomes Parry (4+). For every successful save the wielder makes in close combat, he may make an extra attack back immediately against the model/unit that struck the blow.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: All models in the unit will always Wound enemies on at least a 3+ in close combat. Armour saves are affected by the unit's normal S. In addition, the unit receives +D3 to its Combat Resolution bonus in any turn that they charge.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Ignore Armour saves. For every Wound caused, the enemy model must pass a T test or suffer an additional Wound. In addition, the wielder may cast Wind Blast.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Spear. All attacks (including shooting) with this weapon Hits automatically. In addition, it can be thrown in each Shooting phase following the rules for javelins. Resolve the Hit as if it were from a Bolt Thrower.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Great Weapon. The wielder of this sword gains Flaming Attacks. Against models with T 5 or more, he may re-roll failed rolls To Wound.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

characteristics.$text: Truthsayer only. The wearer of the Triskele gains Ward save (5+) and Magic Resistance (3). The Triskele is not a unique magic item, and one may be worn by each Truthsayer.
characteristics.name: Special Rules

description: All models with this rule re-roll failed charge distances and gain Hatred on any turn that they declare a charge or pursue a fleeing enemy. This lasts for the duration of the turn. However, the models suffer an additional -1 to their LD when taking Break Tests.
sharedRules.name: War Fury

description: Any model wearing Woad Paint gets the Ward save (6+) special rule.
sharedRules.name: Woad Paint

description: All friendly units within 6" of a Hero or 12" of a Lord may add D3" to their charge range.
sharedRules.name: War Cry

description: Models with this rule roll 3D6 for Panic and Break tests, discarding the highest dice rolled. You may not have multiple Tribal Affiliations in the same army.
sharedRules.name: Finians

description: Models belonging to the Fir Domain gain +1 armour save when using shields. You may not have multiple Tribal Affiliations in the same army.
sharedRules.name: Fir Domain

description: Infantry models with this rule may deploy as Ambushers, and get +1 To Hit in close combat when attacking enemies in their flank or rear (excluding mounts). You may not have multiple Tribal Affiliations in the same army.
sharedRules.name: Falians

description: Models belonging to the Sessairs re-roll 1's when rolling To Wound in close combat (excluding mounts). You may not have multiple Tribal Affiliations in the same army.
sharedRules.name: Sessair

description: At the start of each round of combat, the model/unit may take a LD test. If successful, the model/entire unit will use the Spasm Warrior profile and gain Frenzy and Hatred for the duration of the close combat.
sharedRules.name: Spasms of Fury

description: The Fenbeast gains Frenzy.
sharedRules.name: Born of Bloodmarsh

description: Attacks targeted against the Fenbeast suffer -1 to their WS and BS,
sharedRules.name: Fly-Infested Rotweed

description: During any turn in which one or more spells from the Lore of Life or Lore of the Truthsayers is successfully cast within 12", the Fenbeast gains +1 S.
sharedRules.name: Leechloam

description: The Fenbeast's Regeneration is increased to Regeneration (3+).
sharedRules.name: Lifebloom Silt

description: Shieldbearers should be placed on a 40x20mm base and add +2 to the Unit Strength of any model mounted on them.
sharedRules.name: Shieldbearers

characteristics.$text: The target unit gets +1 To Hit with shooting and close combat attacks until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The target unit is Unbreakable until the start of the caster's next Magic phase. If cast on a fleeing unit, the unit immediately rallies, regardless of how many models are left in it. Boosted version affects all friendly units within range.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Targets Fenbeasts, Fenhulks and Viridian Lords. The target unit immediately regains D3 Wounds worth of models lost earlier during the battle up to their starting value, or it may choose to make a normal additional move as if it were the Remaining Moves sub-phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Each unit within range instantly recovers 1/D3 Wound worth of models slain earlier in the battle, following the rules of the Regrowth spell from the Lore of Life.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Remains in play. The unit receives Ward save (5+) until the start of the caster's next Magic phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: The unit cannot voluntarily move in its next Movement phase or shoot in its next Shooting phase.
characteristics.name: Details

characteristics.$text: Whenever a spell from the Lore of the Truthsayers is cast on a friendly unit, enemy units targeting that unit suffer -1 To Hit with missile weapons until the start of the caster's next turn.
characteristics.name: Details

catalogue.name: Albion
catalogue.authorContact: Contact me on the Warhammer Armies Project Discord (1st link) or on the BSData Developers Discord (2nd link)
